H0.text: Reproduction is the process by which organisms give rise to offspring.

H1.text: Differentiation is the process by which organisms give rise to offspring.

H2.text: Evolution is the process by which organisms give rise to offspring.

H3.text: Photosynthesis is the process by which organisms give rise to offspring.

A4.text: Reproduction (or procreation or breeding) is the biological process by which new individual organisms – 'offspring' – are produced from their 'parent' or parents.

A5.text: The existence of life without reproduction is the subject of some speculation.

A6.text: In sexual reproduction new organisms are formed by the fusion of haploid sperm and eggs resulting in what is known as the zygote.

A7.text: Spermatids are now haploid and undergo differentiation into sperm cells.
